snippet: James Murdoch’s role at News International has come under scrutiny amid a phone-hacking scandal at the company’s tabloids.
abstract: James Murdoch resigns as head of his father’s scandal-ridden newspaper properties in Britain; says he will now concentrate on the company’s lucrative international television properties, working from the New York headquarters of News Corporation, Rupert Murdoch’s global media conglomerate.

byline.original: By JOHN F. BURNS and AMY CHOZICK
byline.contributor: John F. Burns reported from London and Amy Chozick from New York. Alan Cowell and Julia Werdigier contributed reporting from London, and Ravi Somaiya from Stockholm.

lead_paragraph: James Murdoch’s role at News International has come under scrutiny amid a phone-hacking scandal at the company’s tabloids.

headline.seo: James Murdoch Quits as Head of Family’s British Press Outpost
headline.main: James Murdoch Gives Up Role at British Unit
headline.print_headline: James Murdoch Quits as Head of Family’s British Press Outpost
